intro: Balanites racemosa, commonly known as the African butter tree, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae and is characterized by its woody, thorny shrub or small tree structure. The plant produces yellowish-white flowers that bloom in racemes, followed by edible, fleshy fruits containing seeds. Its leaves are bipinnate, and the plant is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments. The fruit is used by both humans and animals, and the plant has traditional medicinal uses in some cultures.
